value.title: 5 Lifesaving ⛑ tips in Power Bi you might not know
value.excerpt: You know how this works by now right? If I learn something useful, I share it here with you and in today's video I am going to share my top 5 power bi tips to fix current issues and cool functionality.   Did I manage to surprise you with a tip you didnt know? #curbal #powerbi #5tips  Keynotes: 1. Word

value.title: Add colored KPI arrows to Power BI 2019 version
value.excerpt: Do you know how to create colored KPIs in Power BI in 2019? In this video I am going to show you the way I do nowadays. Do you have a better way? Please share it with us :) #powerbi #kpipowerbi #curbal  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more

value.title: Avoid refresh errors when importing files in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you refreshed Power BI files and got errors due to missing columns or unwanted columns? Here I show you how to avoid new columns for getting added and refresh error from missing columns.  I learnt this by watching Microsoft Power BI webinar with Chris Webb: https://info.microsoft.com/CO-PowerBI-WBNR-FY16-06Jun-21-Amazing-Things-with-Power-BI-Registration.html?Is=Website

value.title: DAX Fridays! #14: SUMMARIZE
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the function SUMMARIZE in DAX/ Powerpivot.  The function SUMMARIZE can return a summary of sales grouped around the calendar year and the product category name, this result table allows you to do analysis over the reseller sales by year and product category.  Source:https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg492171.aspx

value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax

value.title: DAX Fridays! #77: GROUPBY, CURRENTGROUP
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays, we will go through the DAX function GROUPBY with an example.  GROUPBY is similar as SUMMARIZE, but the difference is that in the expression part, you use DAX iterators to get your results. You can also nest GROUPBY functions to get for example the highest sales amount by country.
